section.title: RSSViewer
section.para: Plugin that converts Jmol/JChemPaint into a CMLRSS reader. It extracts chemical information from an RSS newsfeed and displays it in Jmol or JChemPaint. The source code can be found in the cdk-plugins module in CDK cvs. It is licensed GPL.

The module was published in: Peter Murray-Rust, Henry S. Rzepa, Mark J. Williamson, and Egon L. Willighagen, "Chemical Markup, XML, and the World Wide Web. 5. Applications of Chemical Metadata in RSS Aggregators", J.Chem.Inf.Comp.Sci., 2004 (DOI: 10.1021/ci034244p)

The plugin does not have a GUI to configure the RSS sources yet, but instead, these are defined in a configuration file in ${HOME}/.jmol/rssviewer.props. On a UNIX machine this is something like: /home/egonw/.jmol/rssviewer.props. For JChemPaint, the location is ${HOME}/.jchempaint/rssviewer.props. The contents of this file looks like:
section.programlisting:
ChannelCount=2
Channel0=http://www.woc.sci.kun.nl/cgi-bin/rssfeed.rss Channel0Title=Woordenboek Organische Chemie Channel1=http://www.ch.ic.ac.uk/csdemo/feed.php Channel1Title=Imperial College
